*div1 type="summary"* *p*P. W. Grayson to James F. Perry, August 9, 1834. Discussing mission to Mexico in Austin's behalf. Political confusion.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felippe*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="08-09-1834">Aug 9 '34*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir*/p*
*p*I arrived here *date_mentioned n="08-08-1834">yesterday morning*/date_mentioned* and expect to leave, on *date_mentioned n="08-11-1834">Monday*/date_mentioned*—-accompanying *person_mentioned*Col Almonte*/person_mentioned* We are informed on good authority, that the cholera is in *location_mentioned*San Antonio-*/location_mentioned*—deaths 6 or 7 a day,— it commenced about the *date_mentioned n="07-27-1834">27th last month*/date_mentioned*—We are in hopes it will have abated by the time we get on—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Johnson */person_mentioned*writes from there, that he will be able to procure a favorable address from the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamiento*/person_mentioned*.-—*/p*
*p*I have seen the one from *location_mentioned*Matagorda*/location_mentioned*, which is a considerable improvement on the first, but not so full as I could have wished— The Liberty Memorial is well written and is perhaps very good as to the substance tho' there is a little of it I do not like altogether.*/p*
*p*The one from the *location_mentioned*Colorado*/location_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Johnson */person_mentioned*has with him We shall get it from him at *location_mentioned*San Antonio*/location_mentioned* where it appears lie will remain-*/p*
*p*But my main dependence is on *person_mentioned*Almonte*/person_mentioned*-—There is no very important, additional information as to the progress of the Revolution.—4000 *person_mentioned*Sta Anna*/person_mentioned* men, have marched against *location_mentioned*San Louis Potosi*/location_mentioned*— *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*is measurably quiet. We have heard, (to heighten our distresses) that there is even a State Revolution—*location_mentioned*Saltillo */location_mentioned*against Monclova. It seems that the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*of the former place have set up a *person_mentioned*governor */person_mentioned*of their own, in opposition to the one at *location_mentioned*Monclova */location_mentioned*and threaten to storm the place, if the Official papers of all kind, are not given up to them—all is no doubt the work of a *person_mentioned*licentious mob*/person_mentioned*—- What is to come of it I know not of course—as I suppose no one else does—*/p*
*p*I will write you from *location_mentioned*San Antonio*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*P. W. Grayson*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**date_mentioned n="08-11-1834">Monday Evening*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*We shall leave this, tomorrow or next day—waiting on *person_mentioned*Colo Almonte*/person_mentioned*, as *person_mentioned*Jack */person_mentioned*and myself are now ready—*/p*
*p*I have had some talk with the *person_mentioned*Colo */person_mentioned*on the subject of this State disorder—He laments it but thinks he understands the cause and that all will be well soon—Time will tell best.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*P. W. G.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed.] *person_mentioned*Mr. James F. Perry*/person_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Gulf Prairie*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
